name: Miniloft

reviews.text: Miniloftmitte offers apartment style accomodations that make it feel more like home. I had a Compact apartment (sized for 2) which included a fully equipped kitchen with fridge and burners. Overall size of the room and bathroom were very comfortable. My only complaint was lack of shampoo and soap. I didn't realize this and had to go out and purchase at a local store.
reviews.title: Good location and space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and they provide a nice local guide which has recommendations on where to buy groceries and where to eat.
reviews.title: the best place away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great. Across from the Natural History Museum and within 5 minutes to the Zinnowitzer U-Bahn station. Within walking distance to Reichstag and Museum Island.
reviews.title: Cool in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is a wonderful place to stay first because it has every you need in a super comfy, simple and modern design. i love modern and concrete so this was what iwas looking for.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in a great city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the bed is super soft and the linens, great pillow , comforter ...also awesome guide to Berlin and great help if needed.
reviews.title: Must try. Great location, space, people.

reviews.text: The best part about staying at Miniloftmitte is the ease in which everything functions. From my very first inquiry, Marina the manager was the consummate liaison. She was personable and easy to correspond with about important details. Upon our arrival late at night, we found our key where she said it would be and a note on our studio door wishing us hello.
reviews.title: Loved the Miniloftmitte

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a splendid compact studio with furnishings straight out of a design showroom. An open layout and windows almost as tall as the walls, the space literally breathed! The bathroom seemed like a spa with it's full length tub.
reviews.title: Great centre for Berlin

reviews.title: City break base with a difference

reviews.title: Nice modern suite with pantry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Miniloftmitte was a great place to stay allowing you to be free and confident to explore such a vibrant city…we can’t recommend it highly enough.
reviews.title: The Quintessential Berlin Experience!
Miniloft (in Mitte) is brilliant
reviews.text: ''Miniloft provided an ideal base for our recent stay in Berlin. The location's great - with public transport links just a few minutes away, and the cultural and leisure sites of Mitte within easy walking distance. The conversion of the original building into lofts has been very well done, with the resulting apartments offering cool, comfortable and spacious bases for a city break. Booking was done through the Miniloft website and by email and went very smoothly indeed. Quick and efficient response from team, who also provided helpful directions and travel advice pre-arrival. The mini guide to the local area, produced by the team, gives good recommendations for things to see and visit, and places to eat and drink.''

description: "These modestly priced lofts give guests the kudos of living in a real architectural highlight only ten minutes away from the Reichstag - priceless." -- From Mind Bender, published in Wallpaper *, 2005-05 Miniloftmitte's downtown urban studio apartments are an affordable and comfortable alternative to a hotel room. All minilofts are equipped with modern amenities, and the generous floor plans allow you to indulge in the modern luxury of pure space, a rarity unparalleled in normal hotels.
